item.title: Failed monobloc road surface causing vibration, 29th July
item.description:
The speed bump surface directly in front of my building has failed and dropped causing vehicles (especially larger ones like the C10 bus route and coaches for the hotel) to bump over the depression in the surface and cause vibration in our building. My balcony door and living room windows creak when the vehicles pass over it. There looks to be a previous repair using standard blacktop rather than monobloc but this has also now failed. This is a general nuisance but also a potential structural issue for the building. The issue is also heightened by buses also speeding along the street and rattle heavily when they pass over it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeding, 29th July
item.description:
Significant weeding protruding from pavements and curbs along the full length of Queenscroft Road. This makes the street look really run down and unkempt. I pay hundreds of pounds in Council Tax every month. I expect the street I live in to be well maintained without 2ft weeds growing through the pavement. It is an eyesore which is affecting the value of my property that I am planning to sell.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Queenscroft Road, Middle Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light flashing, 29th July
item.description:
The street light in front of 10 Pedworth Gardens is flashing. It also seems this is the only light that has not been modernised in the street (possibly because it's half on the property and the previous owner has not responded to any communication around this?). I am the new co-owner and would welcome if the lamp was fixed/modernised.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Pedworth Gardens, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: From 30 to 24 Chalcot Rd, 29th July
item.description:
It appears recent building works have led to a significant amount of construction waste (what looks like dried concrete) being left on the historic cobbled gutter. From the looks of it, the builders working at or delivering to number 30 have not properly cleaned up after themselves. The buildup of materials is not only unsightly but is actively damaging the historic character of the street. The concrete appears to be drying onto the cobbles and tarmac, which will be extremely difficult to remove if not addressed immediately. Please could someone investigate this as a priority and ensure that the responsible party is instructed to clean the area thoroughly? It would be a real shame to see it permanently damaged due to negligence.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Chalcot Road, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree dropping fruit, 29th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haywood Road, Widmore, London

item.title: Street light opposite shining into property, 29th July
item.description:
The street light is shining into my property affecting my sleep as the bedroom is always light even with the curtains shut. This will need a blocker put to deflect the light from shining onto my property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clovelly Road, West Heath, London
